intro: Campylospermum humblotii, commonly known as the Madagascar bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical climates. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
